How does Tnb04-1 achieve broad neutraliz: By binding to a highly conserved hydrophobic pocket in the RBD, distinct from the ACE2 binding site.
By targeting the spike protein's fusion peptide, preventing membrane fusion.
By binding directly to the viral RNA, inhibiting replication.
By interacting with the viral envelope protein, disrupting viral assembly.
What is the significance of the nanobody: Tnb04-1 binds to a conserved epitope in the spike protein's RBD, maintaining neutralizing efficacy despite spike substitutions.
Tnb04-1 targets the ACE2 binding site, preventing viral entry into host cells.
Tnb04-1 is specific to the Omicron subvariant KP.3.1.1 and does not neutralize other variants.
Tnb04-1 binds to a variable region of the spike protein, making it less effective against new variants.
